content.description:
Climb the well featured wall just to the right of the crack. passing 6 bolts.

At the top of the slab reach up and left to clip the bolt on the wall above.   Make a high step to gain the concave wall above and traverse delicately leftwards across the concave wall.

Clip the last bolt then with another high step gain the slab above and the anchors shortly afterwards.
content.location: right of center on the south face

content.description:
Climb directly up the water chute.

Steeper than it first appears.
content.protection: 7 bolts and 2 directionals to double mussy hook anchors.

climbs.name: Unknown G
climbs.fa: Jim McC, Dave Harden, Bart O'Brien 9/22/17, GU

content.description:
First 2 bolts are super easy climbing Much like mini me or the first time routes here. 3rd bolt is easily gained at a large ledge. The 4th bolt is a little bit of a reach but not bad.

The crux imo is the heady top out. Once you gain the left crack on the mini head wall you can pull your left leg up and almost lie back up to a standing position before topping out. Not super difficult, but the last bolt is about 5 feet to your right so get ready for a ride if you don’t stick it.

Lastly I thought the anchor was a little close to the edge so rapping off the way you climbed kinda sucks.

​
content.location: Just right of The Rubster. Walk around the massive boulder that is seen from the bottom parking area. The beginning of the climb is behind a large bush. The approach is similar to The Rubster.

climbs.name: Unknown F
climbs.fa: FA: Kevin Calder, Retrobolts: Kelly Cordner

content.description:
2 bolts protect the lower slab followed by another bolt that protects a mantle.

3 more bolts lead you up a slab/face to rap rings
content.location: On the face that you can see from the parking lot. Belay on top of boulder

content.description:
Start up a chimney/face and continue up the face to a horizontal hand crack.

Route E in Mammoth Area Rock Climbs book
content.location: Weird Location, in a cave which you can access through a small tunnel or by hopping over a few boulders

content.description: Climb the thin face up to the second bolt.   Once clipped move up and right and follow the small incuts up to the anchors.
content.location: Located just left of the cave entrance

content.description:
The first crux is low down up to the first bolt.   Stay true to the face and don't stray into the crack on the left.

After the first bolt wander up the face to the break and mid height.   After the break the steeper climbing on the face above has some fun moves in a nice exposed position.

Climb the left dihedral directly.

The first half is reasonably well protected with cams and wires, although the rock is a little suspect.

Higher the protection is harder to come by, unless you have a few large pieces.
content.location: Left Dihedral on the north face

content.description:
Clip the first bolt and then using the left wall gain the slab above the bolt.   Continue up to the second bolt by stemming and then after the bolt move right onto the slab.

Climb directly up the slab passing numerous large huecos until a thin section at the last bolt allows the belay to be reached.
content.location: located on the left side of the northern side of the crag.   Take the first deep cleft in the rock as you walk along the north face.   This climb starts on the left in a slot.

content.description:
Start up the large features below the hanging slab.

At the end of the features get established on the slab with one good small edge for the right hand.

The moves up passed the 4th bolts are tenuous and required technique and good friction conditions.

From the 5th bolt continue directly to the anchors.
content.location: Leftmost route on the south face

content.description:
Climb the edge / crack on the left side of the pinnacle.   From the top of the crack move leftwards towards the back arete.    Pass the sapling then move up to the left arete.   Clip the bolt and step onto the wall.

Continue up the right side of the arete passing two more bolts to reach the flat summit of the pinnacle.
content.protection:
3 Bolts, Ring bolt anchor.

Optional 2"-3" gear for starting crack.
content.location:
Located on the belay ledge of

The Rubster

.

You can can either climb the 1st pitch of

The Rubster

, or alternatively scramble around to the left of the start of

The Rubster

, then climb up the chimney on the right to get to the large belay ledge.

climbs.name: Step Up or Ketchup
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron, Justin Colville, Will Crick, 23rd September 2013

content.description:
Start below the short steep wall at the right end of the large slanting feature.

Climb up the wall to reach the wide crack that follows the feature up and left.   Follow this up to the 4th bolt.

Once the 4th bolt is clipped step up onto the slabby face and make delicate and engaging moves up and passed the next three bolts.

Continue traversing leftwards passed well featured rock until possible to climb up directly to the anchors.
content.location: Located on the slab wall on the left side of the deep cleft on the northern side of the crag.

content.description:
The Rubster takes you to the highest point of the rocks that form this section, and provides fine exposed face climbing on the second pitch.

1.  5.10b Climb the arete, either by laybacking the edge or using small crimps on the left side.   At the top of the arete move up the slab and climb the short face and slab up to the anchors.

2.  5.10a Climb up the slabby face to the obvious break just below the midway point.    From here continue up the steeper head wall to a precarious couple of last moves up to the spectacular summit.
content.protection:
1.   5 bolts, double ring anchors

2.   6 bolts, ring and bolt anchor
content.location:
Located to the right of

Fat Bastard

.

Walk around the large boulder on the right of the area.   Scramble up some rounded boulders to get to the base of the climb.

content.description: This climbs the huge huecos up onto the easy angle slab above.
This route climbs through unique rock past 3 bolts. Shares top anchors with a harder climb to the right
content.location: Far right by an overhanging boulder

climbs.name: Make Haste or Tomato Paste
climbs.fa: Justin Colville, Euan Cameron, Will Crick, Ryan DeBruyn, 23rd September 2013

content.description:
Start on the wide ledge below the slab.   Using the rock on the right gain the slab and follow it with little trouble passing the first 5 bolts.  The slab steepens at the 6th bolt where the crux begins.

Make pleasant slab moves passing the next three bolts and then wander up to the anchors.
content.location: Located on the slab wall on the left side of the deep cleft on the northern side of the crag.

content.description: Located between My First Time and Mini Me. A featured slab, to the right of a chimney, to a grainy finish.

Start from the ground (not the boulder behind), and climb the vertical face via some fingery moves up to better holds at the second bolt.

From these holds continue up the wall with a few more sustained moves until a rail is reached.

Once at the rail cruse up to the anchors.
content.location: Far right of the south face

climbs.name: Crystal Tips
climbs.fa: Euan Cameron and Julie Wright, 28th September 2013

content.description:
Start by climbing the long hueco like features.   When the features stop step up left and start to climb the face.

Climb the steepening face via some sharp small crimps until the angle eases and the hold size increases.   From here ease up to the anchors.
